description: This course introduces chemical concepts that are important for students pursuing a study of
chemistry or biology.  Topics include atomic structure, the Periodic Table, bonding interactions
within and between particles, water and its solutions, biological membranes, chemical reaction
types, chemical stoichiometry, equilibrium systems, acids and bases, introduction to protein
structure.  Examples are often pulled from the realm of biological molecules and processes.
Students attend three classes and one 3-hour laboratory each week.  Prerequisite: Chemistry
Placement Recommendation, concurrent registration in Math 120 or equivalent background.
fullname: Integrated Chem/Bio I: Chemical Concepts & Biological Applications
